channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Deep, wide pothole on road, 5th October
item.description:
This pothole almost lead to me having a bicycle accident. I don't know how long it's been there for.

item.title: Dangerous damaged fence, 5th October
item.description:
The fence along Dale Road around grass area is in a very dangerous state. There are large holes, sharp metal edges, and the gate isn’t even working properly. It’s a serious safety risk — a child or animal could easily get injured on the sharp metal. The council keeps patching small sections, but the rest of the fence is still broken and looks terrible. Please can the whole fence be replaced properly this time instead of just doing temporary repairs?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dale Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 52, 5th October
item.description:
Roots have caused damage to pavement and our privately owned property. The tree needs to be removed and roots taken out as it will cause further damage to property effecting two owners
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Esmond Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building waste, 5th October
item.description:
This has become a hassle for me just about a month now to get my pram through with my newborn baby when going along the road it came to the point where I have started to go in the road with him as the last time I went through my buggy tipped with my son in it as my wheels got stuck this is on the Conway road turning just before Miriam

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Conway Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black commercial bin issue, 5th October
item.description:
This bin has been pushed out by a Charlton High St business ten days ago. It’s damaged and overflowing. Rubbish has spread around it attracting vermin. It a disgrace and should have been emptied weeks ago. Please pressurize the business to get it removed. Fine them. This kind of irresponsible behaviour is unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fletching Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urine in stairwell, 5th October
item.description:
Search options on website not working - this is for mopping of communal areas Urine in stairwell has not been cleaned up properlyI in the far north eastern stairwell of Fearnley House. It seems like the area was swept but either not mopped or not mopped with any detergent, the smell is still unbearable. Unfortunately the cleaner often does not use cleaning liquid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Graces Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin left in incorrect location, rubbish accumulating, 5th October
item.description:
A communal bin has been left in a non-designated area. Rubbish is now mounting up in and around it, and on the floor. At the far north eastern corner of Fearnley House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Vestry Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: SORN vehicle on public Highway, 5th October
item.description:
Re my previous report- FixMyStreet ref: 8164065. I reported this vehicle as abandoned and you have replied to say it’s not abandoned, as it is taxed. On checking this, it appears to be taxed as SORN. It is parked on the public highway- outside my house 41 Shawfield Park, therefore parked illegally. It is also causing a dangerous obstruction, blocking my view when driving my car off of my drive. If you are not able to do anything about an illegally parked vehicle, please advise whose jurisdiction this is.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shawfield Park, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ties snapped in storm, 5th October
item.description:
The young trees that have been planted along St George’s Road have ties to keep them upright. However during the storm on Friday night some of the ties have snapped along the road and need replacing. I have put a piece of string on the tree outside no. 23 to hold the tree up temporarily but it needs replacing with the proper ties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St George's Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loads of car bits which are sharp, 5th October
item.description:
So where the big fly tip is fridges and tvs , washing machines there is bits of car bumpers and wing and office chair also been dumped!! The woods is absolutely shocking . Not safe to walk children or animals as there is so much stuff in there. Something need to be put up to stop cars and trucks driving on there and dumping all this stuff.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wayside Grove, Elmstead, London
